website_summaries.verdict: One of the best cameras you can buy for less than $200, the svelte, 10x-zoom Canon PowerShot Elph 330 HS takes beautiful pictures and lets you send them instantaneously with integrated Wi-Fi.

customer_reviews.title: Canon Quality, Canon Integrity
customer_reviews.text: As a "point and shoot" (limited) photographer, this Canon (my second Canon) is a feature-filled yet simple camera that offered all of the "make life easy" features and more. My experience with Canon technical service has been great; they are responsive, very fair, and accessible. The silver camera (pictured) is the one I originally received and it had a technical defect. I contacted Canon and, within 10 days, I had a new camera (my is in black...and I really like the color). It operates beautifully. At this point in time (having only had the camera for a month), I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: JGB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: The best pictures often occur when you least anticipate their occurrence. I used to tote an SLR with all its associated lenses which resulted in a cumbersome carry. The Canon 330 fits almost imperceptibly in one's pocket even though it has a 10X zoom. Combined with an ultra-wide angle and a user friendly format once one gets used to it, it is an excellent camera to carry for photos clearly superior to that of a smart phone. I have used it indoors on high telephoto with no flash, results being fairly good. I haven't used it that extensively yet, especially in video mode, but I have been quite satisfied with it so far, especially for its diminutive size.
customer_reviews.author: tom75230

customer_reviews.title: Meh!
customer_reviews.text: I am a little disappointed with this camera. The button to turn the camera on/off does not work all of the time. Missed a few good shots because I could not turn the camera on when I pressed the button. Always had a fully charged battery installed so that was not the problem. Since this camera is not 100% dependable, I use either my phone or my old Fuji digital camera to take pictures.
customer_reviews.author: LSCS

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera with more to offer than cell phone cameras
customer_reviews.text: In a world where many have switched over to photography via cell phone, this is a refreshing better choice for me. I have purchased some previous Cannon cameras of this kind and this last version is even better with way more functions than I know how to use, but I keep learning as I go. I love the hybrid camera/video function and leave it on all the time so I have these little mini-movies of every event I take pictures at. The self timer, lighting adjustments, special effects features, slow motion, the wide variety of other settings and ease of use make this a much better camera choice for me.
customer_reviews.author: go2garrett

customer_reviews.title: It's a great little camera and will still get plenty of use
customer_reviews.text: This is a late review (my apologies). I bought this in early 2014 and it really opened my eyes to the benefits of digital photography. It's ease of use and quality of pics resulted in my recently upgrading to a DSLR with a larger crop sensor. It's a great little camera and will still get plenty of use. (Sorry, Canon, but when all was said and done, I went with the Nikon D5300.)
customer_reviews.author: Lou Tekavcic

customer_reviews.title: love the camera but I dont know if it was ...
customer_reviews.text: love the camera but I dont know if it was because it was used, but the battery dock or something was faulty. It was not the battery, as I bought a new one from a different place and it still kept dying after 20 minutes. Was sad about it since I was really looking forward to using this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Guadalupe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little camera!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this little camera to go in an underwater casing for a trip to Puerto Rico. It performed great! The video was smooth and the stabilization on it was wonderful. I took a 7D along with me on the trip and the video compared to the 7D was what a lot better than I expected from a point and shoot! I was able to mix the two footages together without anyone else really noticing. I still wouldn't replace my 7D with this camera but it's great to take along wherever we go and take some decent looking video and stills.
customer_reviews.author: J.D. Julander

customer_reviews.title: Sadly not recommended (bacause of battery failure)
customer_reviews.text: Excelent camera. Battery Problem tends to shut down constantly (It's supposed to be a software problem) But pictures and video are fantastic. It's fast and feels great in the hand. It's just so lame that it hast that battery problem. If not would be a great product. Sadly not recommended (because of battery failure)
customer_reviews.author: THX

customer_reviews.title: IN LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: My fiancé has an older model and I love the video/still image aspect. We bought my parents one for Xmas and I was so impressed that as soon as I had the funds, I bought myself one. Its small and perfect for my small hands. I now carry it in my purse and its my go to instead of my phone. Function wise, it is extremely easy to use! Easier than my phone! Quality wise, I'm totally hooked! I had a few test images printed up about a week ago to see the quality of an 8X10 print. A friend of mine is using my camera to do my wedding pics! I was that happy with the quality!
customer_reviews.author: HTurner

customer_reviews.title: great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was dissatisfied with the pictures from my phone but didn't want to weigh down my purse with a nicer camera I own. So, I bought this and have used it quite a bit with excellent results. At first, I was confused because I kept getting short videos in addition to the pictures I was taking, but I learned the easy fix for this "feature." I was able to get some great pictures on a recent trip to Hilton Head Island of wildlife on the beach and in the interior of the island (much different lighting conditions). It is also much better than my phone in low-light conditions. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey R. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Canon camera's for many years and pretty much wear them out! I like having the same battery size and similar functions on my camera's. Ever since finding my first "pocket" camera I rarely ever use a larger one. These little cameras take fantastic pictures and have good battery life in my experience. The only issue I have found so far is how to downsize the pictures easily for sharing - I'm sure there is an easy way to do it just haven't gotten through that learning curve yet! I have not tried the wi-fi setup so I can't comment on that. Overall it is a great little camera.
customer_reviews.author: TORI

customer_reviews.title: Good pocket size camera and good picture quality but the battery needed to be replaced after three weeks of use!
customer_reviews.text: Good pocket size camera and good picture quality but the battery needed to be replaced after three weeks of use! Battery problem was irritating. First, it started while taking photos overseas. The error messages ranged from battery needed to be recharged - battery charger light would keep changing sporadically from no light to green to red - to lens related error messages. The seller - beach camera - pointed me to the Canon Customer Support who was not able to pinpoint the root cause for the problem and wanted me to send the camera back for them to examine it. I took a chance and bought two halcyon batteries which took care of the problem.
customer_reviews.author: CommomSense

customer_reviews.title: Great: Size, Performance, Features
customer_reviews.text: My ELPH 310 was stolen early this year. It was no longer available (at least, at a reasonable price). I looked and looked for a replacement, and when the 330 became available, bought it immediately, just before a vacation. I love the size (slides into any pocket), performance (wide angle to long zoom, picture size choices, quickly ready to shoot), and features (quite a few overrides of "standard" so can take good pictures in difficult lighting conditions). Small negatives: The performance should not be compared to SLRs - picture taking is not instant, but it is adequate. There is no full manual for shutter and aperture - but that is rarely needed.
customer_reviews.author: CRM

customer_reviews.title: No problem with wifi
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this camera a few days. I took some photos that seem to be very detailed and the automatic settings work fine. What I can say for sure is that the wifi is pretty simple. Basically, you need to name your camera. After doing that, I loaded the app on my iPad, made sure the wifi was connected, and it did the rest. If you have a security code, you need to only enter it once. Couldn't be easier. You will need to push one button on the camera to turn on wifi, but that's basically it. No more laptops and cords, and the photos are definitely better than iphone quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sniff

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the pictures is very good. The camera size is small and convenient along ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had and used this camera for almost a year now. It works very well in automatic mode, the mode I primarily use. The only problem is a slight lag between pictures, especially if a flash is required. The battery, however, holds it's charge for much longer than I expected. The quality of the pictures is very good . The camera size is small and convenient along with very good zooming capabilities. Over all this is a very good camera and I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ohmy

customer_reviews.title: It's greatest attribute is size and weight
customer_reviews.text: It's greatest attribute is size and weight... small and light !! Takes very nice photos i.e., much better than most other compacts I've seen. WIFI is quite another matter.......... If your IQ is less than 150, don't even think about trying to pair it to another device... The price is now down $150 from when I bought mine, because the new 350 is out. It's a good buy, at the "now" price, but think I would opt for the newer version, for the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Gene M. Zinn

customer_reviews.title: ANOTHER CANON LENS COVER STOPS WORKING
customer_reviews.text: Was great while it lasted. 10 months of good to very good pictures (nothing spectacular, but fine for travel) and now the dreaded screen cover malfunction. The camera was always kept in its case & looks brand new. Today the lens cover stopped functioning and will not open or close all the way. I hate to force it closed as it will scratch the lens. I can force it open using a Q-tip but it will not close all the way - leaving the lens exposed. Back to Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: FlamingoMom

customer_reviews.title: Lasted One Year
customer_reviews.text: It lasted me one year. Took decent photos, not great, but decent for a small point and shoot. There was a constant battery issue. The battery would be fully charged and the camera kept saying change the battery. Come to find out Canon knew about the issue and you could send it in to get it fixed. I never did. I also had a lot of lens open and closing errors. It lasted one year. . .
customer_reviews.author: SnowDogs

customer_reviews.title: Nice pictures but the WiFi is a bear to connect to
customer_reviews.text: The camera works well and is a nice compact size. It has a decent telephoto and other scene and mode settings. Trying to connect the camera to my wireless router was pretty much impossible as trying to enter the alphanumericspecialcharacter password using the camera's tiny buttons was basically impossible with my arthritic hands and limited attention span. I wish there was a way you could connect it to a computer to enter the password. For now I have just given up on the WiFi. When one of my kids are in town, I will get them to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Spokaneman

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and dependable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for use on a two-week rafting trip. There were no options to recharge a cell phone camera, so I wanted a compact camera that would be easy to carry on my person. The camera needed to be versatile and have good options for additional media and batteries and be somewhat tolerant of adverse environmental conditions. I was very pleased with how well this camera handled the cold, heat, damp and sand on the rafting trip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: my simple needs are satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I'm not too much of a photographer. So I don't have much to compare this to, but it is the best camera I've owned. I mainly am simple with pictures and like to point and shoot all automatically and this camera does that just fine with nice pictures. My hands shake and this camera seems to overcome that disability I have and nearly all of my photos are clear and crisp. I bought it with a AmazonBasics carrying case and an extra battery and extra 32 GB card. All is good. I like the extra battery and I keep it charged and ready.
customer_reviews.author: Al Brown

customer_reviews.title: Small and easy to carry is a major plus.
customer_reviews.text: Yes I like this PowerShot 330 very much. It's small and slides right into any pocket you care to put it in. I am not a avid photographer and use this for various snapshots of this and that. Works great.....photos to me look are great. Controls are easy to learn. I do not use the wi-fi feature....I am just not into social media photo sharing at all. I tried a full sized DSLR cameras once......way too big and bulky for my uses and for my untrained eye, the photo were not discernible one way or the other.
customer_reviews.author: Dale L. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great Compact Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is better than the last camera I got, a sony one. The pictures are so clear and sharp. I used it to take some pictures of our faucet that needs a cartridge, in order for them to know the exact part I need to send the pictures to the manufacturer, the person who received the downloaded pictures said, that the pictures was so good, that it was easy for them to determine the parts to be sent. So far I am happy with this camera. Portable Guy is excellent in their shipping. I am happy I bought it with them.
customer_reviews.author: Lorns

customer_reviews.title: Wife's Xmas present turned out to be great!
customer_reviews.text: 5 months later and this little Elph works great! We stuck it in a small waterproof camera bag and took it to the beaches and on a waterfall hike (literally hiking all the way up the falls in the water) and all of the pictures came out great! Very portable and the batteries last a very long time. Programmable to an extent with a nice feature set. I/we are very happy with the camera! BTW, I own several Canon cameras (EOS w/L-lenses, G15, etc. so I am very experienced with Canon and photography in general)
customer_reviews.author: Outbackwack

customer_reviews.title: Love the features!
customer_reviews.text: I have a large canon powershot camera, and needed something smaller to fit in a pocket or while hiking. This was just the ticket. The photos are fantastic, the zoom is great for such a small camera and the settings and features are a blast to play with. I went with a canon because I have always had such fantastic customer support from them and have loved the other canon's I have owned. I did a lot of review reading but for me this camera was a perfect fit. Did everything (and more) that I needed it too.
customer_reviews.author: Skillswife

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is so easy to use. The pictures are of good quality. I use it all the time. I love being able to capture memories.
customer_reviews.author: Shaylon

customer_reviews.title: I like the picture quality of this camera
customer_reviews.text: I like the picture quality of this camera, but have one big problem with it. The on/off button is very sensitive. I keep the camera in my purse and somehow, the on/off button gets pushed and then the battery drains so when I want to use it, the battery isn't charged. I imagine the same thing would happen if you kept this camera in your pocket. For that reason, and that reason alone, I can't recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Nancybabs

customer_reviews.title: I really like this camera
customer_reviews.text: I took a few pictures with this camera and they came out really nice and the video did as well. It was going to be delivered on 2/13/2014 but there was a bad snow storm in the south and it was delayed by one day and that was fine with me as it was worth the wait. I can't put up much of a review yet since it is still winter here but I think the camera will meet my needs for the Urban Exploration that I do, and was well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Nice features
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my wife. It took her a little time to get used to the buttons and features. I use Canon equipment and love the quality of their pictures. This little camera takes really nice shots and video as well. You can set the aspect ratio for 16:9 and make high def movies. It is a little small and I sometimes have to be careful I don't drop it but it's a very capable little camera even in low light.
customer_reviews.author: JG McClung

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Useful Features and More. Works as advertised-even the wireless access
customer_reviews.text: Was very happy to find a camera that had wireless access to send to my phone. Even better was to get the phone and find that it was easy to set up and that it worked well. The camera is fast and responsive and gives me the control I need including setting access to the flash. (A recent camera purchase was returned because there was no way to turn the flash off completely.) Still learning all the features and where they are in the menu but happy to have so many options..
customer_reviews.author: Day Hiker

customer_reviews.title: This is a great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I have kids who are very active, and I own a film SLR. I got this camera as a backup to my SLR. The camera is compact, light, and takes excellent, excellent pictures in low light. Since I am not experienced with indoor film SLR shooting, I usually get blurry photos with the film SLR. The digital Canon PowerShot I bought specifically for this situation and it has done an excellent job. The pictures are well lit with no flash, and that is what I like.
customer_reviews.author: J. V. R.

customer_reviews.title: Batterie malfunctioning‎!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disapointed with CANON. I've had other Canon's and was very pleased, but something is wrong with this model project. I can garantte that is the model because I've bought 2 of them, one for me and other for my mother. Both of them has the same problem with batteries (original batteries): - many times the camera indicates "change the batterie", but in fact is a conection (contact) problem! I take it out, put it in again, and it works. This happens A LOT! - the batterie ends VERY QUICKLY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Diego Malagueta

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera as all of my other Canon cameras are as well. So simple to use and has great pictures. I didn't think I wanted the longer zoom lens as I normally don't value Zoom. Image stabilization is exceptional and bring faraway shots close and clear. I am also impressed on the Wi-Fi capability. Syncing with my iPhone in less than one minute. No router or external Wi-Fi needed. Simple camera to phone transfer works very easily with simple set up. I would highly recommend this camera and looking forward to exploring more of it's features.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, still testing
customer_reviews.text: Got this camera based on research and many good reviews. Very light compared to my last Canon point and shoot and also very small. I wish it had more metal parts and was slightly bigger. It is a great low light camera, but did not do so well in the shade or bright sun. The program mode is useless and there is not much you can do to customize your settings if auto is not doing a good job. Still do not like it as much as my last camera, but maybe I just need more time with it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Dreskin

customer_reviews.title: Pocket friendly.
customer_reviews.text: My wife actually picked this camera out for me, she's a pro. I wanted something I could carry around and take pictures to post on Facebook. This little thing is perfect for that purpose. This is my first digital camera, and it takes great pictures, zoomed, regular, or macro. I throw it in my pocket where ever I go and, boom there she is when I want her. Light, portable and, easy to us. Who could ask for anything more?
customer_reviews.author: JTD

customer_reviews.title: Just what I had expected
customer_reviews.text: My Canon 880 died but I have liked Canons and it was an easy transition to using the 330. I wanted the 20x zoom of the SX280 but was scared off by some of the problems reviewers were reporting. The Elph 330 was my second choice and it had terrific reviews that appear to be well earned now that I have used the camera for all of our Christmas pictures. I must admit I really have not had much of a chance to try out the advanced features yet but point - zoom - click right out of the box works great!
customer_reviews.author: IwinYouwin

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera !! I bought this for my husband for a present. I have the version of this camera that was out almost 8 years ago...and it still works. I don't know many people that can say their "point and press" digital cameras that they bought 8 years ago are still going strong. So, when I wanted to buy one for my husband, the choice was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Janosko

customer_reviews.title: difficult wifi
customer_reviews.text: I like the camera, BUT I got it because of the WIFI feature. Unfortunately the wifi feature is difficult to connect so I've had it a year with no luck using wifi. Hope I can read some reviews and find ideas on how to connect.pictures are good and no dust behind the lens like the Panasonic lumix cameras I've had previously.
customer_reviews.author: E.M.K.

customer_reviews.title: Ingenious Product
customer_reviews.text: What can one say about an ingenious product from a top innovating camera maker company like Canon. It is not nice to go repeat the features of it but now I carry it with me almost in my pocket wherever I go. Clear HD pics and vids, blue tooth connection - even though I haven't used it yet to direct print or transfer data into my computer, an ELPH 1000 stayed with me for years and I expect this one to continue for the years to come
customer_reviews.author: Mileman

customer_reviews.title: Takes great pictures. I recommend using the strap
customer_reviews.text: Takes great pictures. I recommend using the strap. I didn't. Dropped mine and had to replace it. Good thing they aren't too expensive. Haven't tried to sync it with the computer, but I should. Nice that it has the option.
customer_reviews.author: gs1677

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as a gift for my wife. She wanted something that takes good pics without knowing too much about photography while fitting comfortably in your pant pocket. This fits the bill perfectly. We have had this for about a month at the time of this review and so far it has been perfect. I am no expert in photography, but the pictures in auto mode come out very crisp and the colors are vivid. The 10x zoom is great, but you need a very steady hand or the pictures come out a little blurry. I would recommend this to anyone who is on the lookout for a small camera that dishes out quality pics.
customer_reviews.author: Dhanushka Kularatne

customer_reviews.title: WIFI A DISAPPOINTMENT
customer_reviews.text: I really like the size of the camera, the quality of the pictures it takes, the battery life. What brings the rating down markedly is the WiFi connection (or lack thereof). The reason I bought this camera was so I could easily wirelessly transfer pictures from the camera to my PC, only to find now that it is incompatible with my Windows 7 Home Basic Edition! I thought that was a pretty common software, couldn't figure out why I couldn't get the camera and the PC to find each other, then finally saw the "warning" on page 118 of the instruction manual. Come on, Canon, you can do better than that!
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an early version of this model in 2007. The newer version is smaller, and has more options to enhance your ability to take a good picture. the colors are much more vivid. Best of all I can take HDMI movies of my granddaughter. Unfortunately, as usual, manual that comes with the camera is best read with a magnifying glass. I have yet to take advantage of the Wi-Fi capabilities. Ignore any ratings of one star or two star.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Benson

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: So far I am absolutely loving this awesome camera. I decided to purchase this particular camera because I wanted to take good videos of my son. I noticed many YouTube vlogers use this camera, I figured it must be great if its a go to for people who make their living using it!!! And I have not been disappointed yet. I think my favorite feature is how on a certain setting it takes mini videoe between pictures. I like looking at these and seeing a quick clip of our entire day.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. Just a few buttons (which are of a reasonable size) and lots of built in features. I just keep it on general settings most of the time (I have a Nikon D7100 for the fancy stuff) as I only use this for simple party snap shots. Works great and the zoom is just the right amount for in a room. I would definitely recommend the PowerShot ELPH series to anyone looking for a pocket sized camera.
customer_reviews.author: Dont Need Cable

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: The size is perfect. It easily fits in the palm of my hand and I am a female. And the pictures this camera takes are great and detailed, even in low light conditions. Also, when taking videos, and zooming in and out, the videos come out very good. I have not used it on the internet yet. I have not had the time to figure that feature out yet. But I am really satisfied with this camera. Definitely, a great point and shot camera.
customer_reviews.author: Feline Lover

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera!!
customer_reviews.text: Although there is a newer model, I purchased this because the batteries are the same as in the camera I was replacing. The 330 is absolutely awesome!!! It performs extremely well in low lighting for still shots. I love, love, love the zoom AND how it has a mode to create a video before each still shot. The continuous shoot feature is better than I imagined!! What's not to love about this point-and-shoot camera!!
customer_reviews.author: Billy Gray Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Far surpasses my expectations
customer_reviews.text: The slow-mo feature degrades the video quality at 120fps, and severely degrades at 240fps, but it's still useful and fun. On feature I didn't know it had was that ability to shoot a pseudo time lapse at either 5x, 10x or 20x normal video speed. I LOVE this and been using the heck out it. The full auto setting captures everything I've shot, and uses the flash far less than any other camera I've owned. I highly recommend. Just be prepared to use your finger nails to navigate the settings as it's very small, which is also a feature I love!
customer_reviews.author: James Hall

customer_reviews.title: great little camera
customer_reviews.text: We have had an older version of this camera for 6 yrs and have truly enjoyed it. When we decided to replace the camera, I did a significant amount of research and was quite pleased with the feedback regarding this little camera. It is very user friendly, even for my husband whose hands are larger than mine and who uses this camera several times a wk. We have been very impressed with the quality and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen T. Mckay

customer_reviews.title: Cannon Powershot
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to get the pictures off and the videos as well. They download into Adobe which is not the best place. Camera is easy to use and light weight .Nice for the grandkids to take pictures with. I enjoy it too but zoom is a bit to fast and causes you to take too much time getting closeup shots - especially when you are taking pictures of little kids who don't stay still long.
customer_reviews.author: Lorna J. Benedict

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot ELPH 330 replacement
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble with another make with the lens extending. It died in it's youth. Bought this Canon model and found the picture quality to be superior, but dropped the camera (keep that wrist strap on at all times) which dented at the lens iris mechanism area. As expected, repair was much more than a new one from Amazon, so I got the same model new again. Has just the features I need. Love the low light level operation. I can get no-flash pictures without being told the "picture is out of focus, do you want to save it?"
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an easy to use camera for a European vacation. This camera has a lot of options for customized picture taking but the basic functions work well in a pinch. The size is compact and light making it more likely to be with us when we see the perfect shot. The zoo lens is wonderful. Overall this camera is a vast improvement over my seven or eight year old model.
customer_reviews.author: Ev F.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pocket Camera
customer_reviews.text: Small enough to take with you in your pocket. Excellent image quality. Takes very good 720P movies. 10X zoom works well. Very easy camera to use. Good battery life. Works well indoors with fairly low light for both pictures and movies. Only shortcoming is that the battery door is sort of hard to open and doesn't seem too sturdy. Otherwise, the camera is little short of incredible for the size and price.
customer_reviews.author: JLT

customer_reviews.title: Great Pictures!
customer_reviews.text: This camera makes it easy to take great pictures. It's very light, small and easy to carry on the go. I took this on a trip to Thailand and got many compliments on how great my pictures looked. I couldn't have been more pleased, especially at the price point, which was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: Nice little camera.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to rave about, but nothing to complain about either. It's easy to cary around and works well enough. I really wanted something a little faster, and with the ability to easily choose to force the light on (meaning in one step) but couldn't find that. I'd still like to know if there's something better in this class, but I won't complain about it. Pictures are good.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Serene

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Small size (almost too small!) but large display. Easily fits in a top shirt pocket. More functions that you could ever use. Pictures are clear. Stabilization works very well. Transferring pictures via WiFi is easy, convenient and if I didn't see it, I wouldn't believe it. I can't imagine wanting anything else in a camera of this form factor. Also is holding up well thus far. Recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: gl

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best Camera I ever had! It's so light, & the Pictures it takes are absolutely beautiful! It's easy to use & the battery life is awesome.I love the case that comes with it; everything fits so compact& it's so sturdy.It was a fantastic bargain!
customer_reviews.author: CEE

customer_reviews.title: Everything seller said was true as promised. Delivered right on time, works just like new.
customer_reviews.text: Not always sure about buying used electronic type equipment, but this used camera looks and works perfectly. Thank you, building faith.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Compact Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is what I was looking for, it fits into my pants pocket or shirt pocket. The pictures and HD Video are very high quality. The flash is not powerful but considering the size of the camera you can not expect too much. The camera has a nice feel and the controls are user friendly. My only complain is that the display on the back of the camera is hard to see in bright sunlight. I would recommend it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Dan PCFL

customer_reviews.title: A great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for a cruise I was taking. It is a great very small camera to take along on trips you can put it in a pocket or purse. No trouble to take along anywhere. . It takes great pictures. and is easy to use. I would definitely recommend it to anyone. I used the 10x Optical imaging to shot far away pictures. It worked very well. Everyone raved about the pictures I took on this trip.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Day, night, movement, wind, and snow - this camera can survive it all.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera! I took it on a trip to Iceland where it was snowing, raining, etc and it worked with no issues (was not damaged by the elements). In addition, I was able to use it to take pictures of glaciers, waterfalls, etc really well. It captured the city at night really well - certainly better than any other camera I have had. In addition, it was able to take an okay picture of the Northern Lights whereas usually only super expensive cameras on tri-pods are able to do so. Overall, great experience. The different formats actually have an impact on the camera and can improve the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah B.

customer_reviews.title: Marvelous Camera
customer_reviews.text: We love this one! We still don't know all the great stuff it can do, but what we've tried out has been great. Takes sharp photos, gives you several ways to download to your computer for editing (and you can also edit in the camera). Small but I can access all the buttons, etc., even with fairly large hands. Lightweight and fits in a pocket. All around a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: SLO Life

customer_reviews.title: Great Small Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I use this camera in my Pre-K classroom... and it is GREAT! It has an autofocus feature that allows me to catch my quick moving students. I was delightfully surprised by the hybryd video camera that takes video as you are trying to focus on your subject. The class loves seeing the video outakes of our day. (don't worry... you can turn this off too... but it is a really fun option).
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Munoz

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my daughter to go to summer camp she loves it , loves the color , myself I have a nikon slr , never got a canon camera since I'm a nikon fan but I wanted to try this camera with everything it offered . I don't regret we went around our country took nice pictures can't wait for her to come back from camp to see what she has been up to ... Very happy it's compact , takes nice pictures
customer_reviews.author: M. Moise

customer_reviews.title: The camera is great. I use to do test shots before video ...
customer_reviews.text: The camera is great. I use to do test shots before video taping. The camera is amazing. The 4 stars is because the battery literally only lasts a few minutes before dying and needing to be recharged. I bought the A/C adapter and that helps for all shots done inside. Awesome (video) camera.
customer_reviews.author: satisifed_player

customer_reviews.title: Only Cannon for me
customer_reviews.text: After over 45 years of taking pictures, I dropped and broke my camera. I had a Cannon so I replaced it with a new Cannon model. This camera does everything. I take this point and shoot on all my trips and the pictures I take come out beautiful. I also love the pink because I can see it in my purse.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Amaral

customer_reviews.title: Good value and quality
customer_reviews.text: I would have liked a little more in a camera. I had a more expensive Canon and thought this would be comparable, but the buttons are very different and not particularly user-friendly. I would recommend it for the quality of the photos, but I don't like having to read the manual for everything I wish to do.
customer_reviews.author: Inga Mari

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera packs a punch
customer_reviews.text: My main camera is the Canon 6d, but I wanted something compact for work and general carrying around. The wide angle is what drew me to the camera and it hasn't disappointed. The 10X zoom does a great job too. Works well in low light and the battery life is very acceptable. Thinking about buying an extra one for my wife !
customer_reviews.author: Summit Seeker

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I had this camera (different color) with me recently at a wedding in addition to my Nikon DSLR. The wedding and reception was set in a wide range of lighting situations and the Canon performance similar if not better in some instances to the Nikon. It is also very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl Judice

customer_reviews.title: Takes great photos
customer_reviews.text: You'd be amazed at how much more you get in a photo with the 24-mm wide angle lens. This Canon takes great photos, it focuses quickly, and overall I've been pleased with its performance. On the down side... the plastic housing feels cheap, unlike the old-school stainless steel Elphs. Also, I would have liked a raised thumb grip. The buttons are all flush-mounted on the back. I've inadvertently hit the 'view photo' button on several occasions. I have yet to attempt uploading photos wirelessly from this camera, but will update my review as soon as I get to it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert N

customer_reviews.title: enjoying
customer_reviews.text: This little camera is just what I was looking for. I can fit it in my pocket and always have it handy for photos. I know........I have an Iphone and could use it but, for me, it's faster to use this little Canon. The photos have all been very satisfactory. We had a HUGE ice storm, I got lots of practice with the camera and like the photos I got.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera for the Money
customer_reviews.text: The Elph 330 must be out of production as the prices are low at this time. It's a lot of camera that takes excellent pictures, has a 10x zoom and is one of the smallest cameras that Canon produces. My only complains are: due to the small size, the zoom is not easy to get to the exact setting and the flash cannot be programmed to operate on demand.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Foote

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good little camara
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don't like about this camara is that you have to through the menu to turn on the timer. It's a little strange that the timer is so many clicks away, but I'm getting used to it. Everything can't be at your finger tips. ... One tip for everyone, this camara seems to work better without the flash. So if a picture is a little dark or grainy, try it again without the flash.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons but overall I love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love my camera. I've had it about a year and I'm still getting used to the features. I like and dislike that you have to plug in the battery to charge it. I have to make sure I charge it before anything. I didn't like that I had to purchase a separate memory card. Takes great quality pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Ali 702

customer_reviews.title: Perfect high-quality point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 80+ year old mother - she wanted something that was light, easy to use, and takes good pictures. Well, this is all that and more. The large, clear LCD panel is easy to see, the zoom at 10x is nice and versatile, the lens and sensor combo quality seems great for such a small device, and the anti-shake technology also works well. You can just set it to auto-mode and let it do its stuff with great results. Finally, a point and shoot is much easier for her to hold and use than a smart phone, as well as producing consistently better results. She and I are both very happy with this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Marcus GH

customer_reviews.title: Impressive camera
customer_reviews.text: The camera definitely performs in low light, and the auto setting works wonders! Colors are great, features are easy to use and the size is perfect. Two quick gripes; what happened to the wide screen option and the CD-ROM/online PDF owner's manual is awful...at least provide a quick look guide with the camera itself discussing shooting options. I purchased this days prior to a long trip without internet access, and had to wing my way through learning the camera without a hard copy of a manual. Luckily, it is quite similar in many respects to other Canon cameras I have owned with regards to the menu settings.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Frantom

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 330
customer_reviews.text: This camera is the best! Makes great video and takes great pictures. I had the canon vixia but it broke I didn't want to spend another $1000 on a video cam so I thought I would try the Canon PowerShot ELPH 330 12.1MP. Let me tell you this camera is just as good and way easier to burn dvd's and upload to facebook. I wanted to be able to pop out the card and put it in my computer and make dvd/s from the video. Buy this camera, its easy as pie and makes great video
customer_reviews.author: BagLady

customer_reviews.title: Had to have it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my wife one some time ago and when my pocketable camera got lint inside the lens I decided to get one like hers, but in another color. It is so easy to take anywhere and the image quality is all I require for what I use it for. If I'm going out specifically to shoot I take it as a backup to my larger cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!, but not stoked ...
customer_reviews.text: i had an elph 100 first, and i was stoked with it's features and photo qualities. This camera has almost the same features and some more, but i don't see too much improvement from the elph100, except from the zoom that it is much powerfull, that's the best part for me, But if it wasn't for the zoom may be i would prefer the elph100. I'm just starting to use it, we'll see if it gets better ...
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Puente Cifuentes

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera for the price, lots of features
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised upon opening this packaged camera. It is light and easy to handle. I haven't used it yet as it just arrived so I am anxious to get started taking pictures. The reviews were favorable on this model, hence my purchase and I love the color! I am certainly looking forward to using it.
customer_reviews.author: Bootsy57

customer_reviews.title: JPEG artifact ruins photos
customer_reviews.text: This is my third elph and I regret the purchase. I love the convenience of the camera and I am willing to put up with it only doing jpeg images but the amount of jpeg artifact it consistently (ALWAYS) produces it horrible. I think I am going to sell it.
customer_reviews.author: E. HARRIS

customer_reviews.title: all around worthwhile purchase
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pocket camera that would take good pictures without a lot of fuss, and this one has just served me very well on a long road trip. Its limitations are predictable, given its size, but I'm happy with it. A neck loop would have been useful, but I can find one myself if I really feel the need for it. I would recommend this camera to anyone looking for the same thing: lightweight, pocket-size, good photos, as long as they are aware it's so light it's easy to lose track of if you don't dedicate a zipped pocket to it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gurda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the starting vlogger
customer_reviews.text: Was able to find a great deal used on this camera. Excellent budget camera for the starting vlogger. Best camera under $150 if you can find one used. Excellent low light and VR reduction.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff  Arias

customer_reviews.title: Canon ELPH 330
customer_reviews.text: I used the camera on a recent vacation. Found the camera takes great pictures and the wife likes it because she can carry it around in her handbag. Only complaint is the multiple menu steps required to erase a photo. I should have spent a little more to get a camera with a trash button.
customer_reviews.author: A Prevo

customer_reviews.title: A great little pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera replaced my 5 year old Canon SD1100 that was stolen while on vacation in Guatemala. The camera takes crisp, beautiful photos. It's great for someone like myself who will carry this everywhere every day. The manual basically explains how to set up the camera for AUTO use only. Nothing mentioned about the different settings! I signed up for a 3 hour class locally to understand a little more to get the most for my minimal investment... For the price and the quality, this is the camera for someone who wants to carry a pocket camera rather than a smart phone in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: lakeportauntie

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 330 Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera - fits into a purse or pocket easily. The only thing I wish it had was preset camera settings, ie sunset, underwater, etc. I can do without the WI-FI settings, there are some pictures I don't want to end up on my FB page or on the internet. But that said, I still love the camera and am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: When I make a video and play it back, ...
customer_reviews.text: When I make a video and play it back, the volume is so low I have to place the camera up to my ear to hear the sound. And it’s all the way turned up. Is this normal?
customer_reviews.author: Crissy Marie

customer_reviews.title: great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with this camera. It really produces and at a great price. It is very easy to use and the picture quality is great. It does a great job in low light and keeps the camera shake to a bare minimum. The optical zoom is amazing. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: scc1234

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CAMERA!
customer_reviews.text: I take a lot of photos, on a weekly basis and found this camera to be one of the best, small camera's I have owned. The pictures are magnificent and it works every time. Battery life is good, settings are easy to understand. fits easily in your bag or pocket and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: RN

customer_reviews.title: New camera
customer_reviews.text: I fell and dropped my Canon SX280HS canon, which had never worked well in bright light. It was my third one and I had it only 3 months. Because a friend had an ENPH and it took such great shots, I gave it a try this time. It has everything the other one had but the increased zoom lens. Both have email capacity but I never use it. It takes great pics and is smaller and cheaper!
customer_reviews.author: Larry N. Armentrout

customer_reviews.title: Take it everywhere
customer_reviews.text: It's nice to have a SLR but they are hard to carry everywhere. This camera is small enough to carry all the time so you don't miss an opportunity. The still and video quality is great. The only drawback I have found is not being able to turn the flash on manual. I am trying to find a workaround.
customer_reviews.author: Charles C

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: For a small light weight camera it works great and takes nice wide angle pictures too
customer_reviews.author: Rose Shultz

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working in Less Than 4 Months
customer_reviews.text: Received this cameria on January 7, 2014.. Used a couple times and it sat on the side of my desk. Now the camera won't take a charge and won't turn on. PORTABLE GUY says no refund after 30 days. Don't by this.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothea L.

customer_reviews.title: Happy, happy, happy with this Canon!
customer_reviews.text: Our old Olympus camera finally died, so read the reviews and decided to purchase this camera. The quality is excellent and it's very easy to operate. It has plenty of bells and whistles without being too complicated. I have little hands, so really appreciate the size.
customer_reviews.author: Hoosiermama

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera to replace a Canon elph 310 that was broken. I love the low light photo quality and I use the video feature allot. The 330 seems to have better audio quality than the 310.( Which was my only complaint with the 310) Love the photo and video quality and the pocket size. Easy to take with you everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: harrisrb

customer_reviews.title: fun
customer_reviews.text: Very light, clear pictures. I haven't quite figured out all the things you can do with this camera. Took me awhile to figure out how to use the timer. Thus far that's as fancy as I've gotten with it. I like that it fits in my pocket on trips.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: I have an Elph 300 that I really like, pocket-able and takes really good pictures
customer_reviews.text: I have an Elph 300 that I really like, pocket-able and takes really good pictures. The Elph 330 has some worthwhile improvements 10x zoom and an upgraded Digic 5 processor. Also takes great pictures, a winner in my book.
customer_reviews.author: DLDS

customer_reviews.title: Great camera! The camera is small and slim
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! The camera is small and slim, so it's easy to take anywhere. It also takes great, quality photos. The wifi feature is something I use more than I thought I would. I can easily transfer to my phone and email or upload the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Traci

customer_reviews.title: Wifi is practically speaking non functional on this camera. ...
customer_reviews.text: Wifi is practically speaking non functional on this camera. Tried to connect with a brand new Samsung Tablet and then a one year old smartphone. The camera will connect very briefly with both devices but almost immediately kicks off and picks up another Wifi signal. Spent almost an hour with Canon technical support and they don't have any idea why it won't connect. They did note that this is a 2013 model and there is a newer model out. My suggestion: buy that one and avoid this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Reppert

customer_reviews.title: Best small camera ever.
customer_reviews.text: Best small camera ever - just always make sure it's in a case - don't ever throw it in a purse or briefcase, the "eyelid" system that covers the lens will jam and not work right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 330 12.1MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 3-Inch LCD (Black)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackPowerShot ELPH 330 HS boasts enhanced built-in Wi-Fi that enables you to comment on photos and share them to social networking sites quickly and easily – even within specific groups. The powerful new 10x Optical Zoom with 24mm Wide-Angle lens gets you up close and out wide to capture the world in a whole new way, while the Canon HS SYSTEM – the combination of a 12.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor and DIGIC 5 Image Processor – delivers sharply detailed images with vivid, natural color, even in dark lighting. You'll make memories last in beautifully realistic 1080p Full HD video with a press of the dedicated movie button, and use new Hybrid Auto to automatically create an optimized video overview of your day's activities. High Speed AF ensures well-focused action shots, and Intelligent IS delivers blur-free images. And now shoot longer on a single charge with power consumption-reducing ECO Mode.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER



SHARE WITH POWERFUL STYLE





















Radiant in a sleekly rounded new design, the PowerShot ELPH 330 HS boasts enhanced built-in Wi-Fi® that enables you to comment on photos and share them to social networking sites quickly and easily – even within specific groups. The powerful new 10x Optical Zoom with 24mm Wide-Angle lens gets you up close and out wide to capture the world in a whole new way, while the Canon HS SYSTEM – the combination of a 12.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor and DIGIC 5 Image Processor – delivers sharply detailed images with vivid, natural color, even in dark lighting. You'll make memories last in beautifully realistic 1080p Full HD video with a press of the dedicated movie button, and use new Hybrid Auto to automatically create an optimized video overview of your day's activities. High Speed AF ensures well-focused action shots, and Intelligent IS delivers blur-free images. And now shoot longer on a single charge with power consumption-reducing ECO Mode.

SHARE SIMPLY FROM WHEREVER YOU ARE










BUILT-IN WI-FI® ALLOWS YOU TO WIRELESSLY TRANSFER YOUR IMAGES TO SOCIAL NETWORKING SITES THROUGH CANON IMAGE GATEWAY#; TO A PC OR UPLOAD VIRTUALLY ANYWHERE ON YOUR IOS® OR ANDROID™ DEVICE* WITH THE FREE DOWNLOAD OF THE CANON CAMERAWINDOW APP**
The PowerShot ELPH 330 HS is equipped with enhanced built-in Wi-Fi® for on-the-go convenience when you want to share what you've recorded with friends, family and the whole world. The camera can connect directly to both iOS® and Android™ devices*, and upload images via the free Canon CameraWindow app** without a computer. Easily post your images to your favorite social networking sites through CANON iMAGE GATEWAY# or save them to the online photo album to share anytime, anywhere. The camera's built-in Wi-Fi® also lets you transfer images and video directly to your computer to update friends and family while you're traveling or out and about. Enhanced Wi-Fi® makes posting in real time possible, so you can keep everyone up to date with photos even as events unfold. Easily control the destination of your uploads to social networking sites; share with everyone, or send photos to selected groups. Post to groups, add comments, and edit and upload MOV video files from both iOS® and Android™ devices*. Frequently used devices and accounts are stored in the camera's Wi-Fi® history menu, so you can immediately connect with a simple touch. Share with other Wi-Fi® equipped PowerShot cameras, send images to your computer, and print your photos to Wi-Fi® compatible printers^. Built-in Wi-Fi® on the PowerShot ELPH 330 HS makes it easier than ever for you to express your creative flair, and share it with the entire world!

# One-time registration is required on CANON iMAGE GATEWAY online photo album.

* Compatible with iOS version 5.1/6.0 or later and Android devices version 2.3/4.0 or later. Data charges may apply.

** This software enables you to upload images to social network services. Before uploading images, please be aware that image files may contain privacy related information such as people and places. If necessary, please delete such information. Canon does not obtain, collect or use such images or any information included in such images through this software.

^ Wireless PictBridge certified printer is required.




GIVE YOUR IMAGES A WHOLE NEW PERSPECTIVE
















10X OPTICAL ZOOM WITH 24MM WIDE-ANGLE LENS
The PowerShot ELPH 330 HS features a powerful Genuine Canon 10x Zoom Lens that delivers outstanding optical performance and versatility. Fitting a high-performance lens with such wide zoom range into a camera so thin would normally be considered an impossible feat, but Canon's expert optical engineering met the challenge, developing a lens that achieves outstanding compactness with high zoom power and superb performance. The zoom starts at 24mm wide-angle and extends to 240mm telephoto (35mm equivalent), covering an exceptionally wide range. The telephoto reach gives you the freedom to capture subjects from a considerable distance, while the 24mm wide-angle makes it easy to shoot sweeping landscapes, large groups of people and tall buildings.

OPTICAL IMAGE STABILIZER
Handheld shooting can often lead to camera shake, making photos and videos blurry. Canon's Optical Image Stabilizer is a sophisticated system that uses lens-shift technology to correct for unwanted camera movement. It makes handheld photography more practical, providing excellent image quality in many difficult shooting situations: outdoors at dusk, inside without a flash, and even at the telephoto end of the zoom range without a tripod. For photos, it enables shooting at slower shutter speeds, accommodating more low-light shooting situations than ever before without having to boost ISO sensitivity. With camera shake and vibration reduced, you get a sharper, steadier image. And because it is an optical system, there is none of the image degradation typical with electronic image stabilizers.

EXPERIENCE THE POWER
12.1 MEGAPIXEL HIGH-SENSITIVITY CMOS SENSOR
The PowerShot ELPH 330 HS employs a Canon 12.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor, which delivers state-of-the-art imaging performance and is optimized for use in compact cameras. Utilizing a sophisticated light–capturing design, it provides high sensitivity for improved high ISO capture with reduced noise. It is also a high-speed design, capable of rapidly capturing and moving image data to the processor, enabling faster continuous shooting and faster autofocus.

CANON DIGIC 5 IMAGE PROCESSOR
The latest-generation Canon DIGIC 5 Image Processor works with the PowerShot ELPH 330 HS's image sensor to bring phenomenal increases in processing speed and power, delivering incredible detail in more situations, without the need for artificial light sources. Improved noise reduction produces clearer images when shooting in low light at high ISO speeds. The faster processing speed results in faster continuous shooting capability while maintaining full image quality. With the power of the DIGIC 5 Image Processor, the PowerShot ELPH 330 HS can achieve higher ISO sensitivity and even perform advanced functions like lens correction, special scene modes and much more.

CANON HS SYSTEM FOR EXCEPTIONAL LOW-LIGHT PERFORMANCE UP TO ISO 6400
The PowerShot ELPH 330 HS gives you the power to create images with spectacular depth, detail and emotional resonance. The 12.1 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor works in concert with the DIGIC 5 Image Processor to create the renowned Canon HS SYSTEM. With the Canon HS SYSTEM, you'll experience excellent tracking performance even in low light, and achieve gorgeous still image quality even at high ISO speeds all the way up to ISO 6400; beautiful low-light shots are possible with minimal noise and maximum detail in highlight and shadow areas. The Canon HS SYSTEM lets you use higher shutter speeds to capture clearer images with reduced noise and blur in a variety of situations for incredible photos and even when shooting video.

GET THE COMPLETE HD EXPERIENCE
CAPTURE BEAUTIFUL 1080P FULL HD VIDEO IN STEREO SOUND WITH A DEDICATED MOVIE BUTTON; ZOOM WHILE SHOOTING AND PLAY BACK VIDEOS ON AN HDTV VIA THE HDMI OUTPUT
Simply touch the dedicated movie button on the PowerShot ELPH 330 HS to start recording video in 1080p Full HD that is breathtakingly vivid and realistic. You're free to use the full range of the zoom in movie mode, and sound is recorded in stereo. HDMI output allows you to view and share your video on an HDTV immediately, simply by connecting the camera to the TV with an optional HDMI cable.

REMEMBER THE DAY IN CRISP HD
NEW HYBRID AUTO UTILIZES A COMBINATION OF SMART AUTO AND INTELLIGENT IS TO CREATE A BEAUTIFUL AND STEADY 720P HD VIDEO CLIP IN MOVIE DIGEST MODE EVERY TIME YOU SHOOT A STILL IMAGE
New Hybrid Auto on the PowerShot ELPH 330 HS brings enhanced image quality to the popular Movie Digest feature on PowerShot digital cameras. Movie Digest records up to four seconds of video every time you shoot a still image, then automatically joins the clips into a video that captures the essence of special days: vacations, important occasions, any time you're shooting many shots in a day. With Hybrid Auto, this "highlight reel" is more beautiful than ever. Hybrid Auto automatically recognizes the scene and optimizes camera settings to capture the highest possible image quality. The resulting 720p HD video is properly exposed, crisp and steady.




FASTER FOCUS AND HIGH-SPEED SHOOTING



HIGH SPEED AF GREATLY IMPROVES FOCUS SPEED AND HIGH-SPEED BURST ALLOWS CONTINUOUS SHOOTING (6.2 FPS) WHILE MAINTAINING SUPERB IMAGE QUALITY










































The PowerShot ELPH 330 HS is equipped with Canon's latest advancement in AF technology: High Speed AF. The result of several improved technologies, High Speed AF delivers a significantly faster focus speed of 0.16 seconds and a dramatically reduced shooting lag time of 0.19 seconds for a super-responsive shooting experience that lets you capture every great shot as it happens. The technology also powers the camera's High-Speed Burst with continuous shooting at 6.2 frames per second. Moreover, images captured in High-Speed Burst maintain the camera's superb image quality.




OPTIMAL IMAGE STABILIZATION IN ANY SITUATION
INTELLIGENT IS AUTOMATICALLY CHOOSES FROM SIX DIFFERENT MODES TO OPTIMIZE IMAGE STABILIZATION FOR THE SHOOTING CONDITION
It's easy to capture clear, steady images with the PowerShot ELPH 330 HS, even in low light without using a tripod. That's because the camera is equipped with Canon's innovative Intelligent IS. The system analyzes camera movement and applies the best shake correction method for the shooting situation – allowing you to focus on framing and capturing your shot. For stills, the system automatically selects among Normal, Panning, Macro (Hybrid) and Tripod IS modes. When shooting video, the system automatically selects among Dynamic, Powered, Macro and Tripod IS modes.

Normal Corrects for a wide range of camera movement when shooting stills. Panning Panning motion is detected so that IS does not interfere with desired camera movement. Macro (Hybrid) Corrects for shift-type camera shake, which typically occurs in macro (close-up) shooting. Dynamic Effective for video shooting at wide-angle focal lengths, eliminating the unwanted shaking that typically occurs while walking. Powered Compensates for hand movement when shooting video at the telephoto end of the zoom range, where camera shake is magnified. Tripod When tripod use is detected, the Image Stabilizer is stopped because it is not needed. 
A CHARGE THAT LASTS AS LONG AS A MEMORY
NEW ECO MODE HELPS REDUCE POWER CONSUMPTION FOR LONGER BATTERY LIFE.
The PowerShot ELPH 330 HS takes energy conservation to the next level with ECO Mode, which provides more shots per single charge through LCD monitor and camera power management. ECO Mode can be activated for easy power preservation when an outlet is unavailable or the moment is too exciting to put the camera down. ECO Mode quickly wakes the camera from sleep when a button is pressed. With ECO Mode activated to conserve power, you can even stay connected for longer with the built-in Wi-Fi® feature on the PowerShot ELPH 330 HS. When the fun with family and friends runs late into the night, you can be assured your camera can keep up.


ADDITIONAL FEATURES
SMART AUTO
Smart AUTO for the PowerShot ELPH 330 HS makes it easier than ever to capture the sharp, bright, colorful images and videos you're looking for. By assessing various factors in both the background and the subject, the system recognizes 58 predefined shooting situations and automatically selects the camera settings that will yield the best possible results. Simply frame the shot you want, and in dozens of common or challenging scenarios the camera takes care of the rest. Hard-to-capture shots such as moving subjects, night scenes, backlit subjects, and landscapes at evening or on a bright, snowy day are instantly and effortlessly captured as "keeper" shots. Smart AUTO makes the PowerShot ELPH 330 HS ideal for capturing excellent quality still images and video on the go.

SHOOTING MODES/SPECIAL SCENE MODES
Smart AUTO The camera automatically selects the best shooting settings for optimal quality based on subjects and environmental factors to provide point-and-shoot simplicity. Movie Digest & Hybrid Auto Automatically selects shooting settings for optimal quality and records a video clip every time you capture a still image. One day's worth of clips are then combined into a single video. Program The camera automatically and intelligently selects the aperture/shutter speed combination based on the shooting conditions. Portrait Brings the subject into focus while beautifully blurring the background. Smooth Skin Removes dullness, wrinkles, and harsh shadows for beautiful faces. Smart Shutter The camera automatically takes the photo when people smile, wink, or get into frame. High-Speed Burst Captures rapid action frame by frame, by shooting continuously at a high speed while the shutter button is held down. Handheld Night Scene Take clear and steady pictures at night without the use of a tripod. Fisheye Effect Now you can get the fisheye effect – a classic photographic distortion – without a fisheye lens. Miniature Effect Give images a miniature look with an effect that emphasizes perspective by blurring the top and bottom of the image. Toy Camera Effect Simulates photos taken with "toy" or pinhole cameras, darkening the image at the edges to create a vignette effect. Soft Focus Creates a hazy ambiance that's perfect for portraits and wedding photos. Monochrome Choose from three single-tone effects: Black-and-White, Sepia, or Blue. Super Vivid Super Vivid intensifies existing hues, saturating the scene with bright colors. Poster Effect Poster Effect combines several similar shades into one color, turning subtle gradations into eye-catching, scene-popping contrasts. Color Accent Choose to retain a single color in your image while other colors turn monochrome. Color Swap Select a color and replace it with a color you specify for special effects. Snow Shoot clear snow scenes without darkened subjects or an unnatural bluish tint. Fireworks Create brilliant images of skyrocketing fireworks. Long Shutter Use to blur moving subjects for artistic effect, ideal for urban night photography. Stitch Assist Easy-to-use guidelines simplify the shooting of aligned multiple frames that can later be combined (using bundled software) to create panoramic photos. Movie Record video; unwanted scenes can be deleted in playback mode. Super Slow Motion Movie Record your clips in high speed (approx. 240 fps), and then watch your videos in slow motion.
feature_bullets: Built-in Wi-Fi technology allows you to wirelessly transfer your images to social networking sites through CANON iMAGE GATEWAY
Upload virtually anywhere on your iOS or Android device with free download of the Canon Camera Window app
Capture beautiful 1080p full HD video in stereo sound with a dedicated movie button, zoom while shooting and play back videos on an HDTV via the HDMI output
12.1 megapixel CMOS sensor, DIGIC 5 processor, 10x optical image stabilized zoom and 24mm wide-angle lens
ECO Mode reduces power consumption so you can shoot longer on a single charge; The Battery charger is included in the box.
